intro: Leptopogon flaveolus, commonly known as the yellow lepthead, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are narrow and grass-like in appearance. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and minimal water.
